messages.message:
• The expected output is a design doc
    ◦ It should be detailed enough for you to provide time estimates (in days) for different parts of the work
• We usually do iterative async reviews with our team and engineers from other teams (ex: @Anil bc of his knowledge about flows, @mfichman /@Jeff bc of their db knowledge, etc)
    ◦ Iterative reviews can be helpful for validating a high-level approach before you flesh out more details
• After the design doc has been reviewed and finalized, the authors will create JIRA tickets and assign them to themselves (example (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/INSIGHTS-7193))
• Yes ideally we should finish the tech spec this sprint
    ◦ If you have any questions about the expected functionality, please start a thread in <#C089YHN345S|> and tag me/KD/Jack :raised_hands: 
    ◦ If you have any questions about our current codebase, feel free to ask the BE folks  on our team

Do you have any more questions?

If you do, I scheduled a meeting at 2pm PT to discuss how to split up this effort!

Thanks, that explains it!
I'd assume I should touch only backend parts, is that so?
